result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Artis.  This case was dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes in 15CM112 and 14CM297.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  State moved to read in and dismiss this case.   Plea/sentencing adjourned to 7/20/15 at 10:30 am.
No appearance by defendant.  His counsel Ken Artis was present.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court set all open cases for plea/sent on 7-6-15 at 10:30.

Status conference at 06-08-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-20-2015 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Artis.   Reading of complaint waived.  Court advised defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Court entered NGP on behalf of the defendant.  PTC & STC dates set.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court explained the charge and possible penalties to the defendant.  He said he understood.  Court told defendant to contac SPD today.  Other representation options explained to defendant by court.   Bond set.  AIA set for 4/27/15

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
